newsitem.title: USA: COMEX copper ends higher ahead of LME holiday.
newsitem.headline: COMEX copper ends higher ahead of LME holiday.

text.p: COMEX copper settled slightly higher in largely routine trading with volume heavier than in previous sessions this week due to rolling over of positions from September to December, traders said.
Prices were boosted by shortcovering on LME ahead of a long weekend. LME is closed Monday due to a national holiday.
There will be no regular LME stock report on Tuesday.
A rise of 5,675 tonnes in LME stocks Friday to 271,675 tonnes was in line with trade expectations.
December COMEX settled 0.35 cent up at 90.00 cents a lb, traded 90.65 to 89.30 cents. September went out 1.05 cents higher at 91.70 cents. Volume was estimated at 12,000 lots with 2,669 switches.
COMEX stocks Friday rose 606 short tons to 21,250 tons.
Although global copper production has risen, the market has yet to move into surplus, John Gross of the Copper Journal said.

"To the extent domestic demand remains steady, Asia is growing and Europe is recovering, we believe the global market will consume more metal, thereby preventing a rapid build up of stocks," Gross said.
U.S. durable goods orders in July rose more than expected.
